documentId: Understanding Arguments_ An Introduction to Informal Logic (1)
content:
stance.
Darwin himself offered a tentative proposal about the evolution of the
eye. He supposed that sensitivity to light might come in degrees, and that it
might  be  possible  to  find,  among  existing  organisms,  some  with  a  crude
ability to respond to light, others with a more refined capacity and so on in
something like a series. Perhaps, he speculated, research on these creatures
might expose reasons why the different levels of sensitivity provided an ad-
vantage over rival organisms
